short_description: It emits the name of the columns which are futile.
long_description: It emits the name of the columns which are futile based on 3 scenarios. First, If all values in the columns are unique/distinct, Second, If all the values in the columns are same and Third, If the count of distinctValues in the columns / count of total number of rows in the input table is greater than or equal to the threshold provided in the argument.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: The relation that contains input data.
input_tables.description: The relation that contains input data.

input_tables.name: CategoryTable
input_tables.rDescription: The CategoryTable is generated using TD_CATEGORICALSUMMARY
input_tables.description: The CategoryTable is generated using TD_CATEGORICALSUMMARY

argument_clauses.name: CategoricalSummaryColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Column from summarytable which provides names of the columns in input table.
argument_clauses.description: Column from summarytable which provides names of the columns in input table.

argument_clauses.name: ThresholdValue
argument_clauses.rDescription: The value upto which a particular column in input table is not considered futile.
argument_clauses.description: The value upto which a particular column in input table is not considered futile.
